intro: Tilia × europaea var. rubra, commonly known as the red-leaf lime or red-leaf linden, is a hybrid species within the Tiliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive reddish foliage, which becomes more pronounced in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by small, round fruits. It is typically found in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping and urban environments.
